title: First Account of Jax in New Lore?

embed.description: My name is Axamuk Var-Choi Kohari Icath'or.

body:
Saijax - Sai = Jax

Likes eggs, cracks jokes right as they're about to enter combat.

Described as Master of Weapons, is wielding a polearm.

replies.body: Even if there were other Masters of Weapons, according to the lore of Jax, the mention of his big hands, the eggs and jokes... i guess that... yeah, he is Jax. Maybe he lost the rest of his name when Icathia was defeated, since it seems that the names were titles of some sort.
Perhaps it's something to the like of "Hadji" before the names of people who made a pilgrimage to Mecca/Jerusalem. Since Icathia is destroyed maybe he thinks the honorific is pointless.

The story was a masterpiece. It gave perfect immersion and displayed a kind of ignorance in the mind of the protagonist and the Icathians that well displays the kind we face now.

The Void is described perfectly and now it's really less likely that a human (no matter who he or she is) can come out of it so sane as Kai'Sa had.
Kai'sa was clarified to never having entered the void.  She lived in the caverns that were immediately around the entrance.

"The" entrance...? ;-)

_An_ entrance, sure.
is it possible to clarify if the kohari aren't humans? with jax still having three fingers and two toes.

More likely that Jax got corrupted himself.

The Kohari are just a group of elite guards.

I don't know that this is more likely. Also, it is not clear that the Kohari are a single species, anymore than the inhabitants of Demacia are. Saijax might not be human, but he could easily be fighting alongside humans.

The use of language was deliberate. :-)

Well... I see no way why the narrator wouldn't mention that Jax had 3 fingers only >.>

Unless you guys wanted to keep it unknown to us until you release the Jax complete lore.

You mean like we actually planned ahead and thought about stuff?

I dunno, seems far-fetched... ;-P

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=72yyso95,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-03-02T22:37:10.671+0000)You mean like we actually planned ahead and thought about stuff?

I'd be more concerned if you HAD called it out, since I assume that's normal for whatever Jax is. Be like saying "This is Sacthlocke. You can tell it's him/her because he/she has two arms."

Exactly. Whatever Saijax looks like to the POV character, it's normal enough to be considered unremarkable.

Whether or not that would be the case "today" in Shurima is another matter entirely. :-)
Well you can understand why we assume that Jax was human right? Big purple guy, tied to a place afflicted with the void. The narrator was even amazed that he killed an ascendant.

Ryze is purple too... :-P

(Ryze is my new example to overturn all player theories.)

The guy has been steeped deep in mana, the world runes and a weird pocket dimension off-and-on for centuries, and we know that he used to be a normal human from his Young skin. Ryze is a terrible example if you're trying to say he's an unaltered human.

I'm saying being purple doesn't mean you're touched by the Void.

There are people who seem to think that.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=72yyso95,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T23:40:37.085+0000)
>
> I'm saying being purple doesn't mean you're touched by the Void.
> 
> There are people who seem to think that.

Or that is what Lulu wants us to believe, when the truth is that she is the Purple Watcher, creator of the Purple color and everything related to purple including Ryze and the Void. When she cast her "Whimsy" spell on her enemies, she is actually using Void magic to turning into fearsome Voidborns that look like squirrels... but they arent.

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=72yyso95,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-02T22:16:57.389+0000)
>
> Well... I see no way why the narrator wouldn't mention that Jax had 3 fingers only >.>
> 
> Unless you guys wanted to keep it unknown to us until you release the Jax complete lore.

Why would he mention it? If whatever Jax is or isn't is common enough that it's not an especially weird sight, it's far more likely, from his own perspective, to identify him by what traits make him unique to his kind.

Just like, sure, my friend Frank has five fingers, but that's the number of fingers I'd expect him to have.
Well, the narrator went out of his way to describe names and his people's culture to keep his sanity. Wouldn't a guy like Jax help with that?

What if the Icathians were so unconcerned by race and species, that this wasn't something they talked about?

"This man is green and comes from that other country beyond the mountains" vs "It's the big warrior with the hat" etc.

(Real-talk, we deliberately edited the story in such a way that this exact discussion would take place once it was released. ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED.)

Ok... there are a lot of ways I could snark and cut at you here like a jerk but... I don't want to be antagonistic even though I'm really disappointed in Kai'sa.

So can I just ask how much contact there is between your writing department and the ones that made Kai'sa's splash art and in-game assets?  Her art andvoice work specifically.  From where does the decision how to portray her come?  Did the team writing her decide to make her the way she is, or did that come from elsewhere.  How much input do the writers have and how much of the story is "here's what she's gonna be and here's what she's gonna do, now write up something within those parameters that sounds interesting"?

We have the DNA process (something we'll be talking about more in the near future)

Design = Narrative = Art

All work together from the very beginning of a champion's creation/rework, to create something that is the sum of all three. Our narrative writer (in this case, Michael "Cool Radius" McCarthy) was present from day one, and I had visibility on the whole project too.

We aren't told what to do at the last moment by the artists and designers. :-)

Narrative was an equal 1/3 of Kai'Sa's creation. What you see here was 33.333% informed from the start by the writers' input, INCLUDING all in-game v/o and ability names.

Ok.  Thank you for answering me about that.

Does that mean that the writing team was on board with her look in-game and her voice work?  Can you make suggestions or ask that certain things be added?

Basically, I'd like to know which group decided that Kai'sa should look like a model and sound so much less intense than her backstory is.   Because her story IS good, but that intensity seems to have been lost in translation into a character, and she's got a lot of very generic lines.  Why was so much effort put into recording twelve different voice overs for her missing her snipe power, but they only have one or two about her suit and how messed up it feels?  Or that she's clinging desperately to her humanity... or... well, a lot of things.

I feel like there's a reason for that, but it feels like it's causing confusion when there didn't need to be any, and I personally find it irritating. Like Jax being a void corrupted Icathian would explain his appearance, before the Void update. Unless we'll see more like Jax, I can't fathom making his appearance a mystery.

As clarification for anyone who is confused, there are multiple entrances to the Void on Runeterra. At least one is confirmed to be in the depths, in the surroundings of the Marai. Nami's people. Nami found one in the bottom of the ocean as one of his kind was transformed by it.

Indeed!

And, hmmm... I wonder if there are any other references in the lore to a very deep hole... with ancient and powerful entities trapped in it... ;-P

yeah makes sense that howling abyss goes to the void now. 

wondering, what kind of transition is there between the void and runeterra? is there something like a very distinct line where the tear is or is the transition gradual enough that to a human going into the void it would just feel like going into a deep pit?

I tried to find out, but everyone I sent down there came back completely insane or as a horrible Voidborn monster.

Sorry!

If I ever meet Ornn, I'll ask him.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=72yyso95,comment-id=0002000000000001000000010000,timestamp=2018-03-02T22:39:29.563+0000)

Seems to be some truth to it though, given that that the Freljord isn't know for having many void creatures roaming about. Probably would be if they had an uncontained fissure lying around.

Or maybe something else sealed it, but Ornn was credited with it in the fairy tales?

(I don't know, by the way! I'm just keen to show that nothing is stated absolutely in characterful, interesting lore - I'd rather see a hundred exciting, engaging conversations about a new piece of lore than everyone just saying "Well, now we know!") :-)

Little OT:
How much you love the Lore fo awnser all this comment ? xD
'S my job. I just happen to also love chatting with other people who like to delve into the lore... :-D

So do I.  And the void lore came out VERY good, so credit to the writers.

But MAN am I disappointed with the character we're gonna get in-game.  I want to play shit that feels as cool as the stories you told... not some bland girl in a catsuit that feels so little like the one in her own lore.  

I'm honestly afraid to get invested in league's lore... because I did once and it got changed on me.  Characters change and lore changes and if you liked it the way it was... too bad.  Or just the fact that the lore runs contrary to the product we get to play with in-game.  

Kai in her backstory feels more intense, driven and interesting than Kai in game acts.  Seeing such a lackluster thing come out just makes me more sad that the lore and background is so great... because SHE could have been great.  And she's not.  Not to me at least... and not to a lot of people, judging by the boards.

I must make the writing team feel pretty awful to.  So if I can talk to you about it, I swear I won't go all flamer or troll or anything.  I'm REALLY curious how a riot staff member involved with her creation in any way feels about the final product you guys have made, and how you feel about how it's being received.  I'm not really expecting a reply to this, but... figured I'd give it a shot and see.

Weirdly, the feedback I've seen has been overwhelmingly positive - I've only seen people upset that their headcanon wasn't true, which isn't something I can help with. :-P

I think, where before we had a muddy and inconsistent sci-fi Void, we are now beginning to see that it's not some alien race or Stargate scenario. We have started to explore the Void with the three human champions who have been touched by it, and each of them represents a differing level of interaction/sanity afterwards.

In all honesty, I am really excited to keep developing the Void, and telling more stories. Kai'Sa is the dawn of something new, something that's never been seen on Runeterra before - the Void existing in symbiosis with another living creature, for reasons no one really understands, rather than devouring it.

So, maybe it's because I can see five steps ahead in what we've got planned for all the uncertain or lapsed lore-heads... but I'm really excited that we took this bold first step. :-)

It's all downward and darker from here, believe me...

Obv awnser lul
But... about the Lore of the game (ALL) how you "keep" everything without losing pieces? Quintals of sheet? hours of audio? tera of blocknote? xD

We have lots of lore-minded Rioters who we've been actively recruiting into Narrative, plus we regularly read up on the player boards, communities etc online to see what ideas resonate and which ones create pain. It's way too much for me alone to keep track of... but then again, I've only been here for a year! :-P

I think that actually works in my favour, and I'd hope it will start to show improvements in the general quality of the lore Riot publishes. We're only at the very start, but I'm bringing fresh eyes to something that I wasn't a fan of before now, and I have 7+ years in publishing and IP management... so I know how bad it feels when your audience aren't happy with the direction of the setting. We're trying to set things straight, and improve them, and codify the Runeterra lore for the future - not retcon after retcon, which again creates unnecessary pain.

So, please, let us know how you think we're getting on. And if you notice a genuine mistake or inconsistency, please do tell us! :-)

Just finished reading the Void lore and can say it's a step-up in readability from the previous lore updates.

There is less of a need to sit beside a thesaurus and the flow isn't choked by excessive adjectives.
The inset worldbuilding is also less intrusive than it was in the Demacian update.

I appreciate all of the above; seems to be better proofreading in this update.

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=72yyso95,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T22:21:01.402+0000)

WAAARGHbobo would be better to answer this but roughly "Sai" means desert, but because the people who call it that know a lot of deserts, it has more of a nuanced meaning that kind of means sand ocean, or deserted ocean.  Basically, really big and really barren.

It literally does mean desert. That's confirmed in the lore, several times.

There is mention of the Great Sai, "kas sai a dyn" (whom does the desert know) etc. :-)

We're looking at it something like "erg" in the Sahara.
